alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 17 at 9:38PM EST until February 19 at 8:20PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Allegheny River At Kittanning affecting Armstrong County. Allegheny River At CW Bill Young Dam affecting Allegheny County. Allegheny River At Mosgrove affecting Armstrong County. Allegheny River At Natrona affecting Allegheny and Westmoreland Counties.
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. PAZ021-073-181600- /O.CON.KPBZ.FL.A.0007.220219T1200Z-220220T0120Z/ /NATP1.0.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 938 PM EST Thu Feb 17 2022 ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Allegheny River at Natrona. * WHEN...From Saturday morning to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Navigation suspended, lock out of service. At 21.0 feet, Lock walls overtopped. At 21.3 feet, Water begins to back up into the sewers at Braeburn Steel Co. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EST Thursday the stage was 12.5 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
